label: 嫡子
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: the primary heir, as designated by the Law on Inheritance (Keishi-ryō) of the ritsuryō codes. For those of the third rank or higher, the codes stipulated that the eldest son of the senior consort should be chakushi. His heir was in turn his first son by his senior spouse. The primary heir was supposed to receive twice the share of other heirs and special treatment according to the stipulations of the shadow rank" provision. Other heirs were termed shoshi 庶子.　[継嗣令、律令]　"
